title: Sheet Pan Chicken with Mozzarella, Pesto, and Broccoli Recipe
description: Try this easy recipe for sheet pan chicken with pesto, mozzarella cheese, broccoli, and tomatoes and solve your weeknight dinner woes!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Chicken Pesto Chicken Recipes Sheet Pan Chicken with Mozzarella, Pesto, and Broccoli 4.8 (41) 40 Reviews 22 Photos Easy sheet pan chicken dinner with pesto, mozzarella cheese, broccoli, and tomatoes. Submitted by BMG Updated on November 21, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 22 22 22 22 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 pounds boneless chicken breasts 2 teaspoons garlic salt ground black pepper to taste 6 tablespoons pesto 2 medium Roma (plum) tomatoes, thinly sliced 1 ½ cups shredded mozzarella cheese 1 head broccoli, cut into florets 2 tablespoons olive oil salt to taste Directions Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Lightly grease a large sheet pan. Season chicken with garlic salt and pepper; place onto the prepared sheet pan. Spread pesto over chicken, then top with tomatoes and mozzarella. Toss broccoli and oil together in a bowl; season with salt and pepper. Scatter around chicken on the baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until broccoli is tender and chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Lightly grease a large sheet pan.;Season chicken with garlic salt and pepper; place onto the prepared sheet pan. Spread pesto over chicken, then top with tomatoes and mozzarella.;Toss broccoli and oil together in a bowl; season with salt and pepper. Scatter around chicken on the baking sheet.;Bake in the preheated oven until broccoli is tender and chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
